AcceptDirectConnectTunnel.document: This API is used to accept an application for a dedicated tunnel.
AcceptDirectConnectTunnel.name: Accepts an application for a dedicated tunnel

ApplyInternetAddress.document: This API is used to apply for an internet tunnel’s CIDR block.
ApplyInternetAddress.name: Applies for an internet tunnel’s IP address

CreateDirectConnect.document:
This API is used to apply for a connection.
When calling this API, please note that:
You need to complete identity verification for your account; otherwise, you cannot apply for a connection;
If there is any connection in arrears under your account, you cannot apply for more connections.
CreateDirectConnect.name: Applies for a connection

CreateDirectConnectTunnel.document: This API is used to create a dedicated tunnel.
CreateDirectConnectTunnel.name: Creates a dedicated tunnel

DeleteDirectConnect.document:
This API is used to delete a connection.
Only connected connections can be deleted.
DeleteDirectConnect.name: Deletes a connection

DeleteDirectConnectTunnel.document: This API is used to delete a dedicated tunnel.
DeleteDirectConnectTunnel.name: Deletes a dedicated tunnel

DescribeAccessPoints.document: This API is used to query connection access points.
DescribeAccessPoints.name: Queries connection access points

DescribeDirectConnectTunnels.document: This API is used to query the list of dedicated tunnels.
DescribeDirectConnectTunnels.name: Queries the list of dedicated tunnels

DescribeDirectConnects.document: This API is used to query the list of connections.
DescribeDirectConnects.name: Queries the list of connections

DescribeInternetAddress.document: This API is used to obtain the public IP address of an internet tunnel.
DescribeInternetAddress.name: Obtains the public IP address of an internet tunnel

DescribeInternetAddressQuota.document: This API is used to obtain the public IP quota of internet tunnels.
DescribeInternetAddressQuota.name: Obtains the public IP quota of internet tunnels

DescribeInternetAddressStatistics.document: This API is used to obtain the public IP address assignment statistics of internet tunnels.
DescribeInternetAddressStatistics.name: Obtains the public IP address statistics of internet tunnels

DisableInternetAddress.document: This API is used to disable a public IP address of internet tunnels.
DisableInternetAddress.name: Disables a public IP address of internet tunnels

EnableInternetAddress.document: This API is used to enable a public IP address for internet tunnels.
EnableInternetAddress.name: Enables a public IP address for internet tunnels

ModifyDirectConnectAttribute.document: This API is used to modify connection attributes.
ModifyDirectConnectAttribute.name: Modifies connection attributes

ModifyDirectConnectTunnelAttribute.document: This API is used to modify the dedicated tunnel attributes.
ModifyDirectConnectTunnelAttribute.name: Modifies the dedicated tunnel attributes

RejectDirectConnectTunnel.document: This API is used to reject an application for a dedicated tunnel.
RejectDirectConnectTunnel.name: Rejects an application for a dedicated tunnel

ReleaseInternetAddress.document: This API is used to release an IP address of internet tunnels.
ReleaseInternetAddress.name: Releases an IP address of internet tunnels

members.document: The connection owner accepts an application for sharing the dedicated tunnel
members.name: DirectConnectTunnelId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Access point name.
members.name: AccessPointName

members.document: Unique access point ID.
members.name: AccessPointId

members.document: Access point status. Valid values: available, unavailable.
members.name: State

members.document: Access point location.
members.name: Location

members.document: List of ISPs supported by access point.
members.name: LineOperator

members.document: ID of the region that manages the access point.
members.name: RegionId

members.document:
Available port type at the access point. Valid values: 1000BASE-T: gigabit electrical port; 1000BASE-LX: 10 km gigabit single-mode optical port; 1000BASE-ZX: 80 km gigabit single-mode optical port; 10GBASE-LR: 10 km 10-gigabit single-mode optical port; 10GBASE-ZR: 80 km 10-gigabit single-mode optical port; 10GBASE-LH: 40 km 10-gigabit single-mode optical port; 100GBASE-LR4: 10 km 100-gigabit single-mode optical portfiber optic port.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: AvailablePortType

members.document:
Latitude and longitude of the access point
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Coordinate

members.document:
City where the access point is located
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: City

members.document:
Access point region
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Area

members.document:
Access point type. Valid values: `VXLAN`, `QCPL`, and `QCAR`.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AccessPointType

members.document: Mask length of a CIDR block
members.name: MaskLen

members.document:
Address type. Valid values: 0: BGP
1: China Telecom
2: China Mobile
3: China Unicom
members.name: AddrType

members.document:
Address protocol. Valid values: 0: IPv4
1: IPv6
members.name: AddrProto

ID of the internet tunnel’s public IP address
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: Connection name.

members.document:
Access point of connection.
You can call `DescribeAccessPoints` to get the region ID. The selected access point must exist and be available.
members.name: AccessPointId

members.document: ISP that provides connections. Valid values: ChinaTelecom (China Telecom), ChinaMobile (China Mobile), ChinaUnicom (China Unicom), In-houseWiring (in-house wiring), ChinaOther (other Chinese ISPs), InternationalOperator (international ISPs).
members.name: LineOperator

members.document: Port type of connection. Valid values: 100Base-T (100-Megabit electrical Ethernet interface), 1000Base-T (1-Gigabit electrical Ethernet interface), 1000Base-LX (1-Gigabit single-module optical Ethernet interface; 10 KM), 10GBase-T (10-Gigabit electrical Ethernet interface), 10GBase-LR (10-Gigabit single-module optical Ethernet interface; 10 KM). Default value: 1000Base-LX.
members.name: PortType

members.document: Circuit code of a connection, which is provided by the ISP or connection provider.
members.name: CircuitCode

members.document: Local IDC location.
members.name: Location

members.document: Connection port bandwidth in Mbps. Value range: [2,10240]. Default value: 1000.
members.name: Bandwidth

members.document: ID of redundant connection.
members.name: RedundantDirectConnectId

members.document: VLAN for connection debugging, which is enabled and automatically assigned by default.
members.name: Vlan

members.document: Tencent-side IP address for connection debugging, which is automatically assigned by default.
members.name: TencentAddress

members.document: User-side IP address for connection debugging, which is automatically assigned by default.

members.document:
Connection owner, who is the current customer by default.
The developer account ID should be entered for shared connections.

members.document:
Network type. Valid values: VPC, BMVPC, CCN. Default value: VPC.
VPC: Virtual Private Cloud.
BMVPC: BM VPC.
CCN: Cloud Connect Network.
members.name: NetworkType

Direct Connect bandwidth in Mbps.
Default value: connection bandwidth value.

members.document:
BGP: BGP routing.
STATIC: Static routing.
Default value: BGP routing.
members.name: RouteType

members.document: BgpPeer, which is BGP information on the user side and includes Asn and AuthKey.
members.name: BgpPeer

members.document: Static routing, i.e., IP range of the user's IDC.
members.name: RouteFilterPrefixes

members.document:
VLAN. Value range: 0-3,000.
0: sub-interface not enabled.
Default value: Non-zero.
members.name: Vlan

members.document:
Filter conditions: This parameter does not support specifying `DirectConnectTunnelIds` and `Filters` at the same time.
  • direct-connect-tunnel-name: Dedicated tunnel name.
  • direct-connect-tunnel-id: Dedicated tunnel instance ID, such as `dcx-abcdefgh`.
  • direct-connect-id: Connection instance ID, such as `dc-abcdefgh`.

members.document:
Filter conditions:
  • AddrType, address type. Valid values: 0: BGP; 1: China Telecom; 2: China Mobile; 3: China Unicom
  • AddrProto, address protocol. Valid values: 0: IPv4; 1: IPv6
  • Status, address status. Valid values: 0: in use; 1: disabled; 2: returned
  • Subnet, public IP address array
    • Public IP address ID array
